channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: No Language Left Behind: Scaling Human-Centered Machine Translation
item.description: Driven by the goal of eradicating language barriers on a global scale, machine translation has solidified itself as a key focus of artificial intelligence research today.

item.title: Consistency is the key to further mitigating catastrophic forgetting in continual learning
item.description: Therefore, we examine the role of consistency regularization in ER framework under various continual learning scenarios.

item.title: A clinically motivated self-supervised approach for content-based image retrieval of CT liver images
item.description: We address these limitations by (1) proposing a self-supervised learning framework that incorporates domain-knowledge into the training procedure and (2) providing the first representation learning explainability analysis in the context of CBIR of CT liver images.

item.title: Dual Vision Transformer
item.description: Dual-ViT is henceforth able to reduce the computational complexity without compromising much accuracy.

item.title: CCPL: Contrastive Coherence Preserving Loss for Versatile Style Transfer
item.description: CCPL can preserve the coherence of the content source during style transfer without degrading stylization.

item.title: Exploring Contextual Relationships for Cervical Abnormal Cell Detection
item.description: Specifically, both contextual relationships between cells and cell-to-global images are exploited to enhance features of each region of interest (RoI) proposals.

item.title: Start Small, Think Big: On Hyperparameter Optimization for Large-Scale Knowledge Graph Embeddings
item.description: Knowledge graph embedding (KGE) models are an effective and popular approach to represent and reason with multi-relational data.

item.title: How Robust is your Fair Model? Exploring the Robustness of Diverse Fairness Strategies
item.description: Recent studies have shown that robustness (the ability for a model to perform well on unseen data) plays a significant role in the type of strategy that should be used when approaching a new problem and, hence, measuring the robustness of these strategies has become a fundamental problem.

item.title: Towards Scale-Aware, Robust, and Generalizable Unsupervised Monocular Depth Estimation by Integrating IMU Motion Dynamics
item.description: Unsupervised monocular depth and ego-motion estimation has drawn extensive research attention in recent years.

item.title: COO: Comic Onomatopoeia Dataset for Recognizing Arbitrary or Truncated Texts
item.description: To encourage research on this topic, we provide a novel comic onomatopoeia dataset (COO), which consists of onomatopoeia texts in Japanese comics.

item.title: Slot Filling for Extracting Reskilling and Upskilling Options from the Web
item.description: Disturbances in the job market such as advances in science and technology, crisis and increased competition have triggered a surge in reskilling and upskilling programs.

item.title: DCCF: Deep Comprehensible Color Filter Learning Framework for High-Resolution Image Harmonization
item.description: Image color harmonization algorithm aims to automatically match the color distribution of foreground and background images captured in different conditions.

item.title: Multimodal Multi-objective Optimization: Comparative Study of the State-of-the-Art
item.description: Multimodal multi-objective problems (MMOPs) commonly arise in real-world problems where distant solutions in decision space correspond to very similar objective values.

item.title: Cross-modal Prototype Driven Network for Radiology Report Generation
item.description: Radiology report generation (RRG) aims to describe automatically a radiology image with human-like language and could potentially support the work of radiologists, reducing the burden of manual reporting.

item.title: CAMS: An Annotated Corpus for Causal Analysis of Mental Health Issues in Social Media Posts
item.description: We introduce a new dataset for Causal Analysis of Mental health issues in Social media posts (CAMS).

item.title: A Baselined Gated Attention Recurrent Network for Request Prediction in Ridesharing
item.description: Ridesharing has received global popularity due to its convenience and cost efficiency for both drivers and passengers and its strong potential to contribute to the implementation of the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

item.title: Personalizing Federated Medical Image Segmentation via Local Calibration
item.description: Personalized FL tackles this issue by only utilizing partial model parameters shared from global server, while keeping the rest to adapt to its own data distribution in the local training of each site.

item.title: Wave-ViT: Unifying Wavelet and Transformers for Visual Representation Learning
item.description: Motivated by the wavelet theory, we construct a new Wavelet Vision Transformer (\textbf{Wave-ViT}) that formulates the invertible down-sampling with wavelet transforms and self-attention learning in a unified way.

item.title: Hierarchical Latent Structure for Multi-Modal Vehicle Trajectory Forecasting
item.description: We observe that a similar problem, in which the generated trajectory is located between adjacent lanes, often arises in VAE-based trajectory forecasting models.

item.title: A Penalty Approach for Normalizing Feature Distributions to Build Confounder-Free Models
item.description: In this paper, we extend the MDN method by applying a Penalty approach (referred to as PDMN).

item.title: Gradual Domain Adaptation without Indexed Intermediate Domains
item.description: This coarse domain sequence then undergoes a fine indexing step via a novel cycle-consistency loss, which encourages the next intermediate domain to preserve sufficient discriminative knowledge of the current intermediate domain.

item.title: Depthformer : Multiscale Vision Transformer For Monocular Depth Estimation With Local Global Information Fusion
item.description: We also propose a Transbins module that divides the depth range into bins whose center value is estimated adaptively per image.

item.title: Self-attention on Multi-Shifted Windows for Scene Segmentation
item.description: Scene segmentation in images is a fundamental yet challenging problem in visual content understanding, which is to learn a model to assign every image pixel to a categorical label.

item.title: 2DPASS: 2D Priors Assisted Semantic Segmentation on LiDAR Point Clouds
item.description: As camera and LiDAR sensors capture complementary information used in autonomous driving, great efforts have been made to develop semantic segmentation algorithms through multi-modality data fusion.

item.title: SFNet: Faster, Accurate, and Domain Agnostic Semantic Segmentation via Semantic Flow
item.description: In this paper, we focus on exploring effective methods for faster, accurate, and domain agnostic semantic segmentation.

item.title: DPText-DETR: Towards Better Scene Text Detection with Dynamic Points in Transformer
item.description: However, the used point label form implies the reading order of humans, which affects the robustness of Transformer model.

item.title: Bregman Proximal Langevin Monte Carlo via Bregman--Moreau Envelopes
item.description: The proposed algorithms extend existing Langevin Monte Carlo algorithms in two aspects -- the ability to sample nonsmooth distributions with mirror descent-like algorithms, and the use of the more general Bregman--Moreau envelope in place of the Moreau envelope as a smooth approximation of the nonsmooth part of the potential.

item.title: Planning Sequential Tasks on Contact Graph
item.description: We devise a 3D scene graph representation, contact graph+ (cg+), for efficient sequential task planning.

item.title: CoMER: Modeling Coverage for Transformer-based Handwritten Mathematical Expression Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose CoMER, a model that adopts the coverage information in the transformer decoder.

item.title: Sparse Pairwise Re-ranking with Pre-trained Transformers
item.description: Pairwise re-ranking models predict which of two documents is more relevant to a query and then aggregate a final ranking from such preferences.

item.title: Training Robust Deep Models for Time-Series Domain: Novel Algorithms and Theoretical Analysis
item.description: Despite the success of deep neural networks (DNNs) for real-world applications over time-series data such as mobile health, little is known about how to train robust DNNs for time-series domain due to its unique characteristics compared to images and text data.

item.title: Explainable Legal Case Matching via Inverse Optimal Transport-based Rationale Extraction
item.description: As an essential operation of legal retrieval, legal case matching plays a central role in intelligent legal systems.

item.title: Multi-label Classification with High-rank and High-order Label Correlations
item.description: Previous methods capture the high-order label correlations mainly by transforming the label matrix to a latent label space with low-rank matrix factorization.

item.title: QKVA grid: Attention in Image Perspective and Stacked DETR
item.description: Especially to the performance on small objects, SDETR achieves better results to the optimized Faster R-CNN baseline, which was a shortcoming in DETR.

item.title: Improving Diffusion Model Efficiency Through Patching
item.description: Diffusion models are a powerful class of generative models that iteratively denoise samples to produce data.

item.title: Wasserstein Graph Distance based on $L_1$-Approximated Tree Edit Distance between Weisfeiler-Lehman Subtrees
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this paper clarifies these facts for the first time and defines a metric we call the Wasserstein WL subtree (WWLS) distance.

item.title: Snipper: A Spatiotemporal Transformer for Simultaneous Multi-Person 3D Pose Estimation Tracking and Forecasting on a Video Snippet
item.description: In this paper, we propose Snipper, a framework to perform multi-person 3D pose estimation, tracking and motion forecasting simultaneously in a single inference.

item.title: Supervised Machine Learning for Effective Missile Launch Based on Beyond Visual Range Air Combat Simulations
item.description: This work compares supervised machine learning methods using reliable data from constructive simulations to estimate the most effective moment for launching missiles during air combat.

item.title: Video Dialog as Conversation about Objects Living in Space-Time
item.description: To tackle these challenges we present a new object-centric framework for video dialog that supports neural reasoning dubbed COST - which stands for Conversation about Objects in Space-Time.

item.title: The Harvard USPTO Patent Dataset: A Large-Scale, Well-Structured, and Multi-Purpose Corpus of Patent Applications
item.description: Innovation is a major driver of economic and social development, and information about many kinds of innovation is embedded in semi-structured data from patents and patent applications.

item.title: TGRMPT: A Head-Shoulder Aided Multi-Person Tracker and a New Large-Scale Dataset for Tour-Guide Robot
item.description: A service robot serving safely and politely needs to track the surrounding people robustly, especially for Tour-Guide Robot (TGR).

item.title: ControlBurn: Nonlinear Feature Selection with Sparse Tree Ensembles
item.description: ControlBurn is a Python package to construct feature-sparse tree ensembles that support nonlinear feature selection and interpretable machine learning.

item.title: SuperTickets: Drawing Task-Agnostic Lottery Tickets from Supernets via Jointly Architecture Searching and Parameter Pruning
item.description: In this paper, we discover for the first time that both efficient DNNs and their lottery subnetworks (i. e., lottery tickets) can be directly identified from a supernet, which we term as SuperTickets, via a two-in-one training scheme with jointly architecture searching and parameter pruning.

item.title: L$_0$onie: Compressing COINs with L$_0$-constraints
item.description: Advances in Implicit Neural Representations (INR) have motivated research on domain-agnostic compression techniques.

item.title: Generalization-Memorization Machines
item.description: Under this mechanism, error-based learning machines improve their memorization abilities of training data without over-fitting.

item.title: Deep Learning for Anomaly Detection in Log Data: A Survey
item.description: Automatic log file analysis enables early detection of relevant incidents such as system failures.

item.title: Out of Distribution Detection via Neural Network Anchoring
item.description: Heteroscedasticity here refers to the fact that the optimal temperature parameter for each sample can be different, as opposed to conventional approaches that use the same value for the entire distribution.

item.title: A Non-isotropic Probabilistic Take on Proxy-based Deep Metric Learning
item.description: We model images as directional von Mises-Fisher (vMF) distributions on the hypersphere that can reflect image-intrinsic uncertainties.

item.title: k-means Mask Transformer
item.description: However, we observe that most existing transformer-based vision models simply borrow the idea from NLP, neglecting the crucial difference between languages and images, particularly the extremely large sequence length of spatially flattened pixel features.

item.title: GT4SD: Generative Toolkit for Scientific Discovery
item.description: With the growing availability of data within various scientific domains, generative models hold enormous potential to accelerate scientific discovery at every step of the scientific method.
